byline.original: By NEAL BOUDETTE and MIKE ISAAC
byline.contributor: Neal Boudette reported from Windsor, Ontario, and Mike Isaac from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: Under a partnership unveiled this week, Fiat Chrysler will make about 100 modified Pacificas that Google will outfit with sensors and computers it has developed.

headline.print_headline: Head of Fiat Chrysler Sees Self-Driving Cars in Five Years, Not 20
headline.main: Head of Fiat Chrysler Sees Self-Driving Cars in Five Years, Not 20

snippet: Under a partnership unveiled this week, Fiat Chrysler will make about 100 modified Pacificas that Google will outfit with sensors and computers it has developed.
abstract: Fiat Chrysler Automobiles chief executive Sergio Marchionne says self-driving cars will be on market in five years, not 20 years previously forecast; firm is collaborating with Google on autonomous car.
